vague_description: You need to optimize the combination of two different types of pills to meet daily nutritional requirements while minimizing costs.
detailed_description: My grandma is required to take two medicines Z1 and D3 everyday. She needs to take at least \var{MinZ1} grams of Z1 and \var{MinD3} grams of D3 everyday. These medicines are available in two pills named Zodiac and Sunny. One pill of Zodiac contains \var{Z1perZodiac} grams of Z1 while one pill of Sunny contains \var{Z1perSunny} grams of Z1. On the other hand, one pill of Zodiac contains \var{D3perZodiac} grams of D3 and one pill of Sunny contains \var{D3perSunny} grams of D3. The cost per pill of Zodiac is $\var{CostZodiac} and the cost per pill of Sunny is $\var{CostSunny}. Formulate a LP such that the medicine requirement can be fulfilled at the lowest cost.
target_objective: Minimize the total cost of the pills while fulfilling the medicine requirements
target_constraints: Grandma needs to take at least MinZ1 grams of Z1 everyday
Grandma needs to take at least MinD3 grams of D3 everyday
Number of Zodiac pills is non-negative
Number of Sunny pills is non-negative
target_parameters: Minimum required grams of medicine Z1 per day
Minimum required grams of medicine D3 per day
Grams of Z1 in one pill of Zodiac
Grams of Z1 in one pill of Sunny
Grams of D3 in one pill of Zodiac
Grams of D3 in one pill of Sunny
